page.topic: How to Stop IIS Application Pools
page.description: When updating the Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS, all instances of the Alpha Anywhere server and associated Application Pools must be stopped, otherwise a system reboot is required to complete the installation.
page.discussion: The Alpha Anywhere Application Server of IIS can be updated without needing to reboot the server. Installation of an update without a reboot requires that all instances of the Application Server for IIS and associated Application Pools are terminated before the running the installer. This can be accomplished using the IIS Manager.

section.title: How to Stop Application Pools Using the IIS Manager

step.description: In the Connections pane, expand the server node and click *[Application Pools]* to display all Application Pools.
On the Application Pools page, select the application pool for the published application that is running.
Click *[Stop]* to stop the application pool.
Repeat this process for every running Application Pool until all application pools are *[stopped]*.

see.ref: Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS
